Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Brevibacillin I (Bre I; natural AMPs; nonribosomal peptide, XXL; lipopeptide; XXw1; bacteria, prokaryotes)

Literature.Author: Zhao X, Wang X, Shukla R, Kumar R, Weingarth M, Breukink E, Kuipers OP.2021
Literature.Title: Brevibacillin 2V, a Novel Antimicrobial Lipopeptide With an Exceptionally Low Hemolytic Activity.

Sequence Information.Comments: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (92.31%) toBrevibacillinChemical modification: T1 dehydrated (Dhb); K3=Orithine, N-terminus is acylated with 2-hydroxy-3-methylvaleric acid (lipo); C-terminus is a characteristic valinol (an alcohol form of valine).Activity: Active against Gram+ S. aureus ATCC159750 or MRSA (MIC 2 ug/ml), E. faecium LMG16003 (VRE), E. faecalis LMG16216 (VRE), B. cereus ATCC14579 (MIC 2 ug/ml), Gram- A. baumannii ATCC17978 (MIC 64 ug/ml), E. coli ATCC25922 (MIC 32 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa LMG6395 (MIC 64 ug/ml), and K. pneumoniae LMG20218 (MIC 64 ug/ml).Toxicity: highly hemolytic: HC50=18.8 ug/ml and toxic: IC50 of HepG2 cells is 7.38 ug/ml.
